revised_title: Temperature Variations in the Head: An Experimental Study
tldr: This study examines the temperature variations in different regions of the head, comparing the temperature of symmetrically situated spaces on both sides of the head. The results show that the temperature differences between the right and left sides are generally small, with the majority of spaces having equal or nearly equal temperatures. The study provides a detailed analysis of the temperature distribution in the head, which can be useful for understanding human physiology and temperature regulation.
